titleStmt.title: J. K. Price to Beriah Magoffin
CWG10796

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: The undersigned Jos K Pria says he was fined at this the August term of the Warren Eq & Criml Court $60 & cost on a charge for Keeping a tippling house in 1858. Now yr Petitioner states the Charge in the indictment is unjust and untrue. There were but two witnesses & these two did not prove a sale the jury only inferred it -- one of sd witnesses is a deadly enemy of Mine & is Now under indictment for murder in this County -- I am a poor man with a family -- I ask humbly for a remission of my fine in whole if not in part -- A respite would be appreciated, but much higher would I appreciate a remission --
The undersigned citizens of Warren Co Ky respectfully unite in requesting the Govr to extend relief to the Petitioner Jos K Price

E T Smith
E B Meddin
And Akinson
A. C. Cox
S. C. Young
Jos W. Barclay
Tom L Burnam
A Howard
C O"Neill
tom Biggs

Warren Eq. Ct
$60 } Tipling
Jos K Price
